title: Li + H2O - volume of gas produced with K vs Li

content.description:
A 0.35 g sample of Li(s) is placed in an Erlenmeyer flask containing 100 mL of water at 25Â°C. A balloon is placed over the mouth of the flask to collect the hydrogen gas that is generated.

After all of the Li(s) has reacted with H2O(l), the solution in the flask is added to a clean, dry buret and used to titrate an aqueous solution of a monoprotic acid. The pH curve for this titration is shown in the diagram below
content.question: What will be the effect on the amount of gas produced if the experiment is repeated using 0.35 g of K(s) instead of 0.35 g of Li(s) ?

choices.label: No gas will be produced when K(s) is used.
Some gas will be produced but less than the amount of gas produced with Li(s).
Equal quantities of gas will be produced with the two metals.
More gas will be produced with K(s) than with Li(s).

content.answer: Some gas will be produced but less than the amount of gas produced with Li(s).

skill.text: 2.F: Explain how modifications to an experimental procedure will alter results.
